context_analysis.energy_patterns: Energy level 7/10 indicates good capacity for both focused work and physical activity. Weekend schedule allows for flexibility.

reasoning.scheduling_strategy: Front-load echo dev work in early morning when energy is fresh (06:00-09:30). Use 09:30-10:00 for quick house tidying before golf. Golf 10:00-13:00 block. Afternoon for healthcare tasks, meal planning, and grocery shopping. Evening for final house preparation.
reasoning.energy_optimization: Leverage morning energy (7/10) for focused development work. Golf provides active recovery mid-day. Afternoon tasks are lower cognitive load, suitable for post-golf energy dip. Evening tidying is light physical activity.
reasoning.priority_sequencing: 1) Echo dev (most important objective), 2) Golf commitment (fixed time), 3) Healthcare task (administrative), 4) House prep and meal planning (relationship priority), 5) Grocery shopping (if time permits)
reasoning.recovery_planning: Golf serves as active recovery from morning coding. Post-golf lunch break allows physical recovery. Evening wind-down after house prep ensures readiness for Hunter's arrival.

key_insights: 3.5 hours of morning focus time maximizes echo dev progress before golf
Golf commitment creates natural break and active recovery mid-day
Afternoon tasks strategically ordered: healthcare (requires focus) before shopping (flexible)
House cleaning split into two sessions to ensure completion before Hunter's arrival
Schedule allows flexibility to skip grocery shopping if other tasks run long
